page.title: 15TIMBER WORK IN FLAKEBRIDGE
page.content: I am a tree feller by trade,& came to Flakebridge to fell some large oaks in June 1984,when the miners were on strike.(The mines take most of the wood we fell).We finished the fell in 6 weeks,by which time trade was really depressed.Much mature timber was left standing.Next we were offered a scrub clearance project;trees like pea rods growing as thick as corn in a field. This was not work we would normally consider but we were glad to take whatever we could.The next spring we started fencing & planting the cleared area,erecting rabbit wire round the boundary.We planted 12 acres Norway Spruce & 6 acres of the same with one sycamore in 4 added.This was about the most profitable job we did here.Lastly we thinned some softwood which took us to May 1985.The miners'strike was ended at last.
